title: [Large-Scale] Play-Based Science Learning Design in Social Virtual Reality (SVR)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic science concepts and proficiency in mobile device utilization
context.additional_context: Students explore scientific concepts through team-based projects in social virtual reality environments and access microlearning content via mobile devices. Learning outcomes are measured through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Play-based learning activities in a social virtual reality environment enhance learners' inquiry skills regarding scientific phenomena
Design at least three SVR learning scenarios applying the TANC model (Theme, Action, Narrative, Supplementary Elements)

Learners can form a team of 3 peers using virtual reality collaboration tools (ENGAGE or AltspaceVR), design climate change response strategies over 4 weeks, and submit a final presentation meeting ≥4 points (out of 5) in ≥4 of 5 evaluation criteria (creativity, scientific validity, practicality, collaboration efficiency, visual expression).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
